businessCaseConclusion.e_text:
Your team has made some early determinations based on input from each team member, and you have ensured the Quality focus is reflected in the project from the very beginning.

The painter's tape has passed the gate review and has been selected for development into a new product. Congratulations!

businessCaseIntro.e_text:
This will be your navigation and performance dashboard as you progress through the phases of commercialization.

Select icons on your map to begin activities. You can complete the activities in any order you wish. Once you have completed all activities for a phase, you will proceed to the next phase and debrief with your team.

conclusion.e_text:
The valid test methods for the Adhesive Strength specification have been identified.

Remember for any design specification to be measured by a test method, the specification description must be concise, quantifiable, and measurable.

Quality inspects the work of the rest of the team, so it could be easy to think Quality becomes more involved with the team's efforts later in commercialization after initial work is complete. This is a misconception.

Instead, Quality should be involved as early as possible, contributing to the team’s efforts.

Note that while you will be an advocate for the VOC in the activities and deliverables completed in Build Business Case, it is a risk to lose sight of other design inputs as you do so.

For example: Industry standards can be easy to overlook, but they are vitally important to identify early.

The cross-functional team should draft the FMEA together. This helps ensure risk identification is not unevenly distributed. For example, identifying possible product performance failure modes, but overlooking possible regulatory or manufacturing failure modes.

Coverage across multiple functional areas and categories helps to ensure the product design will be robust and cover all major failure mode challenges.

questions.e_questionText: The team has begun populating the DQM with information collected in the LHOQ. The product requirements need to be translated into design requirements.
questions.e_instructions: Select the column of the DQM where the translation of product requirement into design requirement is captured.

feedback.e_text: The design requirements are identified by translating key product requirements into specifications. Specifications must be defined in plain terms, and these descriptions and values are recorded in this column of the DQM.

This column is used to identify test methods that will be used to validate specifications.

The correct choice was the Specification Descriptions and Value column.
This column is used to add additional comments about a specification, but it is not where the specification is defined. The correct column is the Specification Descriptions and Value column.

questions.e_prompt:
Next, test methods need to be identified.

If the team needs to measure adhesive strength, which of the test methods below is most appropriate?

feedback.e_text:
The test method should be related to the customer need or want, as defined in the Design Requirement column of the DQM.

Adhesion to key surfaces might be appropriate, while the other test methods are unlikely to have a strong relationship to the design requirement.

Testing how the tape peels off a roll, testing for adhesion to key surfaces such as metal, and testing the force required to move the tape from a surface are all valid test methods for testing adhesive strength.

Impact, reflectivity, roll length, and drop testing are not, at face-value, strongly related to adhesive strength and would not be valid tests for the specification.

questions.e_prompt: The team is evaluating product feasibility. As Quality, at what point in Build Business Case should you get involved in the commercialization of a new product?

choices.e_text: Quality is not involved in the Build Business Case phase of commercialization

feedback.e_title: This isn’t the right team mindset.
feedback.e_text: As the Quality team member, you should be involved with the team’s efforts from the beginning.

choices.e_text: Quality gets involved when all Build Business Case deliverables have been completed, but before the gate review

feedback.e_text: As the Quality team member, you should be involved with the team’s efforts from the beginning.

choices.e_text: Quality should be involved from the start of the project and works with the cross-functional team on a variety of deliverables

feedback.e_title: This is the team role to strive for!
feedback.e_text: Quality should be involved with the team’s efforts from the beginning. This means collaborating on all relevant deliverables.

questions.e_prompt:
You meet with Marketing/Business to review progress in identifying design inputs for the business case.

Which of the following design input categories must you include?

correct.e_text: Quality will be chiefly concerned with ensuring customer wants and needs (VOC) are reflected as design inputs. However, for a product to have a strong business case, additional inputs must be present: Business and market feasibility, industry standards, subject matter expert input, and competing product data.

incorrect.e_text:
As the Quality team member, you’ll be chiefly concerned with ensuring that customer wants and needs (VOC) are reflected as design inputs.

However, for a product to have a strong business case, additional inputs must be present, such as the following: Business and market feasibility, industry standards related to the product, subject matter expert input, and reviews of competing products.

questions.e_prompt:
You are beginning to work on the FMEA for the new painter's tape and process.

Which of the following types of failure mode should be your focus as you work with the team?

choices.e_text: Understanding the customer or market failure

feedback.e_text: Understanding the market and identifying a potential failure mode in this area is important, but other types of failure modes should be considered by the team as well.
While design of product specifications is an important failure mode to focus on, other types of failure modes should be considered by the team as well.

The team needs to identify potential risks or failure modes for the product in the category of raw material selection/supply chain, but other types of failure modes should be considered by the team as well.

choices.e_text: Legal requirements and product sustainability failure

feedback.e_text: The team needs to identify potential risks or failure modes for the product in the category of legal requirements and product sustainability, but other types of failure modes should be considered by the team as well.

choices.e_text: All of these failure modes are important

feedback.e_text: For the initial checklist that will be developed into the FMEA to be effective at minimizing risk, all relevant categories where failure modes could emerge must be accounted for and these should take equal priority.
